summary: An internal FBI email chain from June 8, 2020, discussing the SDNY's investigation into Ghislaine Maxwell and the MLAT request for Prince Andrew. It details planned charges against Maxwell, investigative steps (mail cover, pen register, surveillance), and coordination with Prince Andrew's counsel.

persons.name: Prince Andrew
persons.context: His counsel was issuing a public statement in response to an MLAT request from SDNY prosecutors; there were conversations about interviewing him.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The email details plans to obtain a six-count indictment against her, lists the proposed charges, and describes ongoing surveillance efforts (mail cover, pen register).

connections.description: Both are subjects of the same SDNY investigation into the Epstein case, with prosecutors seeking to interview Prince Andrew as part of the ongoing probe into Maxwell.

events.title: Internal FBI update on Maxwell investigation and Prince Andrew MLAT
events.description: FBI agents discuss the status of the SDNY investigation, including planned charges against Maxwell, investigative steps, and communications with Prince Andrew's counsel regarding an MLAT request.

keyFacts: As of June 2020, SDNY planned to seek a six-count indictment against Ghislaine Maxwell, including charges for conspiracy to entice minors, enticement, conspiracy to transport minors, transportation, and two counts of perjury.
Investigators had a mail cover on an address believed to be Maxwell's residence and had renewed a pen register (Pen) for her phone, with plans to conduct surveillance.
SDNY prosecutors had communicated with Prince Andrew's counsel regarding an MLAT request and a potential interview, though no interview was immediately scheduled.
The email chain shows internal FBI coordination regarding public statements and investigative steps in the high-profile case.
